title: French citizens' convention calls for sweeping school schedule reform
subhead: The 133 randomly selected participants of the citizens' convention a five-day school week with major changes to how learning is structured, while choosing to leave the vacation calendar largely untouched.

title: 'I told him about my day in real time': The couples who can't stop texting on WhatsApp
subhead: While couples in France exchange an average of nine text messages a day, some go far beyond, updating their partner in real time about every event in their day-to-day lives. Is this constant connection a sign of profound intimacy, or a need for control?

title: Why Grok is first and foremost a disinformation machine
subhead: Grok, the chatbot that has been integrated into the X social network and aims to rival ChatGPT, has recently spread Holocaust denial and false information about the November 2015 attacks in France. It was a reminder that Elon Musk's tool, far from being neutral, was designed to misinform.

title: Niklas Frank, a son consumed by hatred for his Nazi father
subhead: Niklas Frank, an 86-year-old former journalist, is known in Germany for his absolute loathing of his father. As a Reich official, Hans Frank, appointed by Hitler in Poland, was among those sentenced to death at the Nuremberg trials, which began 80 years ago.

title: Fiona Hill: 'The US is giving Russia tremendous influence over Europe'
